snippet: An experimental drug appears to preserve and possibly even improve the ability of boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy to walk, but there are caveats.
abstract: Experimental drug eteplirsen, made by Sarepta Therapeutics, preserves and even improves the walking ability of boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy in a clinical trial; it remains unclear how long the drug's effects will last or if safety issues will arise.
lead_paragraph: An experimental drug appears to preserve and possibly even improve the ability of boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy to walk, but there are caveats.

headline.main: Drug Shows Promise in Treating a Type of Muscular Dystrophy in Boys
headline.print_headline: Drug Shows Promise in Treating a Type of Muscular Dystrophy in Boys
